content.question:
<math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math>
<math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math>
<math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math>
<math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math>
<math alttext="4"><mn>4</mn></math>
<math alttext="negative 2"><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math>
<math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math>
<math alttext="5"><mn>5</mn></math>
<math alttext="negative 1"><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math>
<math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>
<math alttext="6"><mn>6</mn></math>
<math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>
<math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math>
<math alttext="7"><mn>7</mn></math>
<math alttext="7"><mn>7</mn></math>

The position of a particle in the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane is given by the vector-valued function <math alttext="p open parentheses t close parentheses equals x open parentheses t close parentheses vector i plus y open parentheses t close parentheses vector j"><mi>p</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mover><mi>i</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mover><mi>j</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>. The table gives values for <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> at selected values of <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math>. Which of the following could define <math alttext="p open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>p</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="t times vector i plus open parentheses t squared minus 2 close parentheses vector j"><mi>t</mi><mo>·</mo><mover><mi>i</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mover><mi>j</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>

<math alttext="t times vector i plus open parentheses t squared plus 4 close parentheses vector j"><mi>t</mi><mo>·</mo><mover><mi>i</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced><mover><mi>j</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>

<math alttext="open parentheses t plus 4 close parentheses vector i plus open parentheses t squared minus 2 close parentheses vector j"><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced><mover><mi>i</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mover><mi>j</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>

<math alttext="open parentheses t plus 4 close parentheses vector i plus open parentheses negative 1 times open parentheses negative 2 close parentheses to the power of t close parentheses vector j"><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced><mover><mi>i</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mi>t</mi></msup></mrow></mfenced><mover><mi>j</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parentheses t plus 4 close parentheses vector i plus open parentheses t squared minus 2 close parentheses vector j"><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced><mover><mi>i</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mfenced><mrow><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mover><mi>j</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
